intro: Anidrum pungens, commonly known as the sharp-leaved anidrum, is a flowering plant native to the humid forests of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ligulate florets. The plant features narrow, serrated leaves that are covered in a fine pubescence, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters that attract various pollinators. Anidrum pungens is often found in shaded, moist environments, where it thrives in the undergrowth of tropical woodlands.
